qas.question: In orthography and typography, what is the distinction between the letters that are in larger upper case and lower upper case
Minuscule is a term uses to describe which case of letter?
Capital letters refer to which case of letter?
Letter case is used to distinction betweem lowercase and uppercase letter in which common representation of certain languages?

context: In orthography and typography, <a0_0>letter case<a0_0/> (or just case) is the distinction between the letters that are in <a2_0>larger upper<a2_0/> case (also capital letters, capitals, caps, large letters, or more formally majuscule, see Terminology) and <a1_0>smaller lower<a1_0/> case (also small letters, or more formally minuscule, see Terminology) in the <a3_0>written<a3_0/> representation of certain languages.
